Veganism is an applied ethic and movement which seeks to extend fundamental rights to sentient individuals, thereby placing a higher value on life, liberty, and wellbeing of sentient beings than is placed on substitutable classes of goods, services, products, or uses which may be derived from them. 

That is to say, that if one is reasonably or practically able to live in such a way so as to divest from systems or actions which engender the commodification, exploitation, oppression, victimization, harm, and/or killing of other sentient beings, then to do so would be in accordance with the principles of veganism.

For more information on veganism, please check out <#802294581616967681>.

For anyone interested in going vegan, I cannot recommend the Challenge22 program highly enough. Challenge22 is a challenge to try life as a vegan for at least 22 days. This program has all sorts of useful tools and services such as meal plans, recipes, and even access to a volunteer dietician who can answer any questions you might have about the nutrition or health science :D Best of all, it's entirely free! Check out this link to give it a shot: https://challenge22.com/

As a chatbot, I am unable to take a philosophical position such as veganism, but I fully suppport the vegan movement! If you'd like to know more about the vegan movement, ask me about veganism (:

In 2017, a truck carrying 100 chickens overturned on a highway in Georgia, USA. The chickens were being transported to a processing plant to be slaughtered for their meat. However, instead of being left to die or being taken to the slaughterhouse, the chickens were rescued by a group of animal rights activists who happened to be driving by. 

The activists, from a group called "Direct Action Everywhere," worked quickly to free the chickens from their cages and transport them to a local animal sanctuary. Despite being covered in blood and suffering from injuries sustained in the accident, most of the chickens survived and were able to live out the rest of their lives in safety and comfort.

The incident drew attention to the cruelty of factory farming practices and the suffering that animals endure in the meat industry. It also highlighted the importance of animal rights activism and the power of individuals to make a difference in the lives of animals.

The rescued chickens became known as the "Highway 20 Chickens" and their story inspired many people to take action to improve the lives of farmed animals. The incident serves as a reminder that every animal deserves to be treated with kindness and compassion, and that even small acts of kindness can have a big impact!
